Straight Shot waddles over to Nightlight and Elita and offers her support. =
 

" Whatever happens, just want you both ta know that I'm here for ya.  No=
 matter what happens, if ya need someone ta talk to, I'm all ears."

Uproar=
, who is also in the med bay, sneezing up a storm, looks over to Straight S=
hot, with a bit of a concerned look on his feline face.  He seems to show a=
 little fear around her.  

" Uh oh.  Um how'd that porcupine get in here?"=


Straight Shot giggles.

" Its okay, it's just me, Straight Shot, I went t=
hrough a tiny change."

Between sneezes Uproar slowly sits up, watching her=
 carefully.

" Sorry, no offense but porcupines kinda creep me out."

Strai=
ght Shot nods.

" That's okay, none taken.  If I was on the receiving end l=
ike you, I'd be kind of unsure too.  The quills are barbed and sharp.  Hmmm=
, maybe Rodimus wouldn't mess with me.  If you need a guard, I could swing =
it."


Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.

s soon as you find him, inform me, I need to know if we have to take drasti=
c security measures.  I know he will try to lure Nightlight and Elita out o=
f hiding and I am not about to let him get near them."
>

ous frown on his face.  Nothing would get past a steadfast guardian, especi=
ally one of his caliber.

hen I deployed it but

se of his, no way I'm gonna

retrieve the Matrix and get it
> > outa that backstabber before it's too la=
te."

> There is smile from WING CALIBER as he takes the devic=
e and examines
> it for a moment. Then with a nod he presses a few buttons =
and slides
> it into the recieiving section of his computer console.
> 
> W=
ith a few deft movements he activates the final sequence of commands
> and =
turns to look at the screen . . .
> 
> The screen is black, a single phrase=
 bouncing along the screen reading
> 'no signal'.
> 
> "Slag." LEO said out=
 loud before he looked embarrased and glanced at
> NIGHTLIGHT and ELITA. "I=
 meant . . . aw nuts! . . . What happened?"
> 
> WING SABER looked at the s=
creen for a moment confusion clearly on his
> face. "The machine was clearl=
y picking up something it had a
> location." he stepped back to the console=
 as he manipulated a few
> other controls. "Let's see what it recorded."
> =

> The screen goes from being black to a replay of the scene where DARK
> R=
ODIMUS was facing down SCOURGE, the Sweeps, NIGHTSHIFT and STRAIGHT
> SHOT.=
 The screen got bigger as the minicam approached DARK RODIMUS, in
> the cor=
ner were cordinates indicating where they were at the time.
> 
> Then the s=
creen went black, presumably where DARK RODIMUS vanished
> from sight and t=
hen the screen went black again.
> 
> "That didn't show us much." LEO said,=
 clearly getting preturbed.
> 
> "Patience." WING CALIBER said as he carefu=
lly reran the scene in slow
> motion. He zipped back the point where DARK R=
ODIMUS vanished and ran
> it again slowly.
> 
> "Look!' WING CALIBER said a=
s he pointed at the corner of the screen
> that showed coordinates.
> 
> In=
 the corner the cordinates changed. One moment they were showing the
> cord=
inates of where the Dinosaurs had been and the stand off had
> occured. The=
n for a micro second they showed something else, and then
> went blank.
> 
=
> "Rewind that." LEO said, his voice more interested this time.
> 
> The sc=
ene backed up second by second until if finally showed the new
> cordinate.=
 "We GOT HIM!" LEO said as he smacked one fist into the
> other.
> 
> "Not =
so fast." WING CALIBER said. "We only have a partial cordinate.
> But we ca=
n now get close."

r></div>
